p: Bacterial strains stored at −80 °C in glycerol suspension were sowed on plates containing tryptic soy agar (TSA—Thermo Fisher Scientific, Milan, Italy) and incubated overnight at 37 °C. Subsequently, one colony from these cultures was inoculated in a culture broth of brain heart infusion and incubated at 37 °C for 24 h to obtain freshly cultured microbial suspensions.
